description.narrative: The Community Strengthening Program works with 15 Karen ethnic communities with about 5,537 populations in 2 sub-districts of Mae Cham district, Chiang Mai province. The target groups have been encountered basic human rights violations. Apparent argument is that sub-communities are being taken advantage by official villages, making them lack of necessary information, services from the government and that they lack of official leaders to raise their human rights related problems to higher level. Most of the communities are in the reserved forest areas and encounter problems on natural resource management and that they are risk to have their land confiscated by the authorities. In addition, the government plan to construct the dam in the areas, if succeeds, can force communities to leave the area while affecting their livelihood and the loss of their land. In terms of gender roles, Women are still inferior to men. The project aims that the target communities know, successfully access their rights and have the capacity to manage their own communities so as to bring about more equitable communities. The project objectives are to see the communities develop the human rights learning process, have increased capacity and collective collaboration for their community development and their rights protection, increased participation of gender roles, and increased capacity of the MEDF for the support to the target communities. The project expects to see target communities with their greater understanding of, collective response to basic human rights, awareness on systematic natural resources management, participation among the community’s members for community’s activities, awareness on gender roles and success implementation of the organization development plan. The major activities are capacity building, network empowerment, gender roles promotion. Main thematic focuses include basic human rights, democracy, good governance, gender equality. Other stakeholders include the government sectors such as District office, Forestry office and NGO’s including human rights and environmental networks.
This project mainly contributes to results within Democratic culture. Results will be reported later in the Global Civsam grant period 2016-2020
